Communication module¶

modbus_connection:¶

class modbus_gui_app.communication.modbus_connection.ModbusConnection¶

Bases: object

A class that is used for the communication between the application and modbus devices.

user_action_dict¶

A dictionary that contains the current information being exchanged between the device and user generated actions (i.e. requests and responses).

Type

dict

dicts_by_tid¶

A dictionary that contains the aforementioned user action dictionaries that get assigned with a transaction id (tid) when the request is being generated. That TID is used to differentiate between user actions (transaction IDs are unique).

Type

dict

tid¶

A unique transaction ID that incrementally changes whenever a request is being generated. Every pair of request and response is saved to a dictionary that contains that ID. When the ID reaches the maximum hexadecimal value of 0xFFFF, it resets to 0x0000.

Type

int

session¶

A variable that is used so that the session can be opened and close by an outside actor.

Type

aiohttp.ClientSession()

live_update_states¶

A dictionary that contains the current information being exchanged between the device and automatically generated requests (live update of the information).

Type

dict

logger¶

A custom logger object that writes any exceptions raised into a file.

Type

modbus_gui_app.error_logging.error_logger

async open_session()¶

A method that opens an aiohttp.ClientSession() and logs an exception if one happens.

Raises

Exception – An exception is raised if the connection cannot be established. The error is logged.

async ws_read_coils(start_addr, no_of_coils, unit_addr)¶

A method that transforms the given arguments into a byte request that reads coils from a specified device.

Parameters

  • start_addr (int) – The starting address from which the coils are being read.

  • no_of_coils (int) – The specified number of coils to be read.

  • unit_addr (int) – The unit address on the device.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the deserialized response and the information about it.

Return type

pending_response(dict)

Raises

Exception – An exception is raised if the request is not sent. The error is logged.

async ws_read_discrete_inputs(start_addr, input_count, unit_addr)¶
A method that transforms the given arguments into a byte request that reads discrete inputs

from a specified device.

Parameters

  • start_addr (int) – The starting address from which the coils are being read.

  • input_count (int) – The specified number of discrete inputs to be read.

  • unit_addr (int) – The unit address on the device.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the deserialized response and the information about it.

Return type

pending_response(dict)

Raises

Exception – An exception is raised if the request is not sent. The error is logged.

A method that transforms the given arguments into a byte request that reads holding registers

from a specified device.

Parameters

  • start_addr (int) – The starting address from which the coils are being read.

  • h_regs_count (int) – The specified number of holding registers to be read.

  • unit_addr (int) – The unit address on the device.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the deserialized response and the information about it.

Return type

pending_response(dict)

A method that transforms the given arguments into a byte request that reads input registers

from a specified device.

Parameters

  • start_addr (int) – The starting address from which the coils are being read.

  • in_regs_count (int) – The specified number of holding registers to be read.

  • unit_addr (int) – The unit address on the device.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the deserialized response and the information about it.

pending_response(dict)

Raises

async ws_read_loop()¶

This method continuously reads the incoming responses and processes them. It ignores the start of the communication and end of the communication messages (ACK, CLOSE, CLOSED…) and only takes into a consideration the messages that contain byte data in their body. Those messages are split into responses to the automatic requests and responses to a user request.

async ws_refresh()¶

This is a generic method that is called by an outside live-update handler. It is used to serialize and send a request for the automatic refresh of the data being used in the program.

Raises

Exception – An exception is raised if the data was not sent.

async ws_write_single_coil(start_addr, coil_state, unit_addr)¶
A method that transforms the given arguments into a byte request that writes a coil value

into a specified device.

Parameters

  • start_addr (int) – The starting address from which the coils are being read.

  • coil_state (int) – Value to be written in a coil. It can only be 1 or 0.

  • unit_addr (int) – The unit address on the device.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the deserialized response and the information about it.

Return type

pending_response(dict)

Raises

Exception – An exception is raised if the request is not sent. The error is logged.

async ws_write_single_register(start_addr, reg_value, unit_addr)¶
A method that transforms the given arguments into a byte request that writes a coil value

into a specified device.

Parameters

  • start_addr (int) – The starting address from which the coils are being read.

  • reg_value (int) – Value to be written in a register

  • unit_addr (int) – The unit address on the device.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the deserialized response and the information about it.

Return type

pending_response(dict)

Raises

Exception – An exception is raised if the request is not sent. The error is logged.

live_update_req_serializer :¶

modbus_gui_app.communication.live_update_req_serializer._automatic_request_serialize(live_update_states, tid)¶

This function picks the correct serialization function based on the function code found in live_update_states.

Parameters

  • live_update_states (dict) – The dictionary that needs to be updated with the current automated request data.

  • tid (int) – The transaction id that will be used in the request.

Returns

Bytes of the request that is serialized, and the dictionary that contains the information

about the serialization.

Return type

bytes, dict

modbus_gui_app.communication.live_update_req_serializer._read_coils_automatic_request_serialize(live_update_states)¶
This function updates the dictionary by giving the previous valid request a new transaction ID.

It then updates the dictionary with new values.

Parameters

live_update_states (dict) – The dictionary that contains the previous request. The updated request is saved into it.

modbus_gui_app.communication.live_update_req_serializer._read_discrete_inputs_automatic_request_serialize(live_update_states)¶
This function updates the dictionary by giving the previous valid request a new transaction ID.

It then updates the dictionary with new values.

Parameters

live_update_states (dict) – The dictionary that contains the previous request. The updated request is saved into it.

  • updated request is saved into it. (The) –

live_update_resp_deserializer:¶

modbus_gui_app.communication.live_update_resp_deserializer._live_update_response_deserialize(live_update_states, bytes_response)¶

This function is used to pick the right deserialization function based on the function code.

Parameters

  • live_update_states – The dictionary that contains the request and is updated with the deserialized values.

  • bytes_response – The response that needs to be deserialized.

modbus_gui_app.communication.live_update_resp_deserializer._read_coils_live_update_deserialize(live_update_states, hex_response_array, deserialize_dict)¶
This function deserializes the input response based on the information found in the live_update_states

dictionary, calls the function that does the deserialization (deserialize()), which saves the result into a dictionary.

Parameters

  • live_update_states (dict) – State dictionary that contains the corresponding request and will contain deserialized response.

  • hex_response_array (list) – Response bytes that are split into an array

  • deserialize_dict (dict) – A dictionary that contains the information about the request and response (both serialized and unserialized).

Returns:

modbus_gui_app.communication.live_update_resp_deserializer._read_discrete_inputs_live_update_deserialize(live_update_states, hex_response_array, deserialize_dict)¶
This function deserializes the input response based on the information found in the live_update_states

dictionary, calls the function that does the deserialization (deserialize()), which saves the result into a dictionary.

Parameters

  • live_update_states (dict) – State dictionary that contains the corresponding request and will contain deserialized response.

  • hex_response_array (list) – Response bytes that are split into an array

  • deserialize_dict (dict) – A dictionary that contains the information about the request and response (both serialized and unserialized).

Returns:

user_request_serializer:¶

modbus_gui_app.communication.user_request_serializer.read_coils_serialize(start_addr, no_of_coils, unit_addr, tid)¶
This function serializes the input data into a request that will be sent and saves the serialization information

into a dictionary.

Parameters

  • start_addr – The starting address from which the coils are being read.

  • no_of_coils – Number of coils to be read.

  • unit_addr – The unit address on the device.

  • tid – The transaction id that will be used in the request.

Returns

Bytes of the request that is serialized, and the dictionary that contains the information

about the serialization.

Return type

bytes, dict

modbus_gui_app.communication.user_request_serializer.read_discrete_inputs_serialize(start_addr, input_count, unit_addr, tid)¶
This function serializes the input data into a request that will be sent and saves the serialization information

into dictionary.

Parameters

  • start_addr – The starting address from which the coils are being read.

  • input_count – Number of discrete inputs to be read.

  • unit_addr – The unit address on the device.

  • tid –

    The transaction id that will be used in the request.

    Returns:
    bytes, dict: Bytes of the request that is serialized, and the dictionary that contains the information

    about the serialization.

user_response_deserializer:¶

modbus_gui_app.communication.user_response_deserializer.check_for_response_errors(response_dict, hex_response_array, logger)¶

This function deserialized the response and checks whether it contains any error messages.

Parameters

  • response_dict – A dictionary which is used to save the error checking result and the error(if there is any).

  • hex_response_array – The byte

  • logger (logging.logger) – A logger that saves any raised exceptions.

Returns

True if valid, False otherwise.

Return type

boolean

modbus_gui_app.communication.user_response_deserializer.read_coils_deserialize(modbus_response, start_addr, response_dict)¶

This function deserializes the input data into information that is stored in a dictionary.

Parameters

  • modbus_response (byte) – The part of the request that contains information about the request result.

  • start_addr (hex) – The address from which the reading starts.

  • response_dict (dict) – A dictionary that is used to save the deserialized data.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the information about the deserialized response.

Return type

dict

modbus_gui_app.communication.user_response_deserializer.read_discrete_inputs_deserialize(modbus_response, start_add, response_dict)¶

This function deserializes the input data into information that is stored in a dictionary.

Parameters

  • modbus_response (byte) – The part of the request that contains information about the request result.

  • start_add (hex) – The address from which the reading starts.

  • response_dict (dict) – A dictionary that is used to save the deserialized data.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the information about the deserialized response.

modbus_gui_app.communication.user_response_deserializer.read_holding_registers_deserialize(modbus_response, start_add, response_dict, logger)¶

This function deserializes the input data into information that is stored in a dictionary.

Parameters

  • modbus_response (byte) – The part of the request that contains information about the request result.

  • start_add (hex) – The address from which the reading starts.

  • response_dict (dict) – A dictionary that is used to save the deserialized data.

  • logger (logging.logger) – A logger that saves any raised exceptions.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the information about the deserialized response.

Return type

dict

Raises

Exception – Number of bytes in the response that represent register values needs to be an even number. If it isn’t, an exception is raised and logged.

modbus_gui_app.communication.user_response_deserializer.read_input_registers_deserialize(modbus_response, start_add, response_dict, logger)¶

This function deserializes the input data into information that is stored in a dictionary.

Parameters

  • modbus_response – The part of the request that contains information about the request result.

  • start_add – The address from which the reading starts.

  • response_dict – A dictionary that is used to save the deserialized data.

  • logger (logging.logger) – A logger that saves any raised exceptions.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the information about the deserialized response.

Return type

dict

Raises

Exception – Number of bytes in the response that represent register values needs to be an even number. If it isn’t, an exception is raised and logged.

modbus_gui_app.communication.user_response_deserializer.user_response_deserialize(bytes_response, communication_dictionary)¶

This function deserializes chooses the correct deserialization function (based on the function code).

Parameters

  • bytes_response (bytes) – Received response that needs to be deserialized.

  • communication_dictionary (dict) – A dictionary that contains the information about the request that prompted this particular response.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the information about the deserialized response.

Return type

dict

modbus_gui_app.communication.user_response_deserializer.write_single_coil_deserialize(response_dict, bytes_response)¶
